isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Power Cylinders - Clean, Inspect, and Test - Cylinder Sleeves

step1.para: Inspect inside surface of sleeve for indications of scuffing, scoring, or polishing. Replace sleeve and piston as required.
Inspect outer surface of sleeve for cavitation erosion. Replace as required.

svcsubproc.title: Measure Cylinder Sleeve: Telescoping Gauge Method

step1.para: Measure cylinder sleeve inside diameter at top of piston ring travel (just below carbon ridge area) with Telescoping Gauge Set (OEM1022) and Outside Micrometer .
Measure cylinder sleeve inside diameter at the bottom just below ring travel area.
Determine cylinder sleeve wear (taper), measure difference between upper sleeve inside diameter and lower sleeve inside diameter.
If cylinder sleeve wear " Specifications " are exceeded, replace sleeve.

svcsubproc.title: Measure Cylinder Sleeve: Cylinder Bore Gauge Method

step1.para: Measure cylinder sleeve inside diameter at top of piston ring travel, just below carbon ridge area with Cylinder Bore Gauge (OEM1032) .
Measure cylinder sleeve inside diameter at bottom of piston ring travel, just below ring travel area.
Determine cylinder sleeve wear (taper), measure difference between upper sleeve inside diameter and lower sleeve inside diameter.
If cylinder sleeve wear " Specifications " are exceeded, replace sleeve.

svcsubproc.title: Measure Cylinder Sleeve: Feeler Gauge Method

step1.para: Measure cylinder sleeve inside diameter at top of piston ring travel, just below carbon ridge area. Install compression (top) ring squarely above top of ring travel. Measure ring end gap with a Feeler Gauge.

note.para: Use piston to be sure ring is seated squarely in bore.

step1.para: Measure cylinder sleeve inside diameter at bottom of piston ring travel, just below ring travel area. Install same piston ring squarely below top ring travel turnaround area and measure ring end gap.

Determine cylinder sleeve wear (taper), measure difference between upper sleeve inside diameter and lower sleeve inside diameter. Every 0.07 mm (0.003 in) increase in ring gap equals a 0.025 mm (0.001 in)increase in bore size.
If cylinder sleeve wear " Specifications " are exceeded, replace sleeve.

svcsubproc.title: Measure Cylinder Sleeve Counterbore: Cylinder Liner Height Gauge Method

step1.para: Mount Cylinder Liner Height Gauge on crankcase deck. Zero dial indicator on crankcase deck.
Move indicator to counterbore ledge and measure depth. Perform counterbore depth measurement at four points equal distance around counterbore.
If maximum variation between four measurement points for counterbore depth exceeds " Specifications ," resurface counterbore.

svcsubproc.title: Measure Cylinder Sleeve Counterbore: Depth Micrometer Method

step1.para: Measure cylinder sleeve counterbore depth at four points around sleeve with a Depth Micrometer .
If maximum variation between four measurement points for counterbore depth exceeds " Specifications ," resurface counterbore.
Thoroughly clean cylinder sleeve and counterbore area of crankcase.

Install cylinder sleeve in cylinder bore without O-rings. Install Cylinder Liner Holding Adapters (ZTSE25151)
with grade 8 bolts and hardened washers. Tighten all three bolts in two steps as follows:
Place dial indicator tip of Surface Gauge on cylinder sleeve flange. Zero indicator and move block until indicator tip slides off flange to crankcase deck.
Take measurements at three points around sleeve.

Use average measurement to determine which shim(s), if any, is needed to bring cylinder sleeve protrusion within " Specifications ." See "Adjust Cylinder Sleeve Protrusion" in this section for more information.
